definition: to put into (one's pockets, clothes)/Taiwan pr. [chuai3]
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: From that I gather that he is a conscientious worker.
sentences.chinese: 从这一点我揣想他工作是很负责的。

sentences.english: We suspect they'll be a little late.
sentences.chinese: 我们揣想他们会晚来一会儿。

sentences.english: She gathered that they were installing the machines.
sentences.chinese: 她揣想他们正在安装机器。

sentences.english: From what John said I gather he'll be giving up his job in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 从约翰所说的，我揣想他将在夏季辞掉工作。

sentences.english: My own views, admittedly somewhat speculative, are that they probably do not consider their actions as reprehensible .
sentences.chinese: 以笔者揣想，他们大概是认为此等行为无可指摘。

definition: to speculate/to surmise/to wonder whether/to guess
passing thought/an idea that comes into one's head/recollection
to turn things over in one's mind/to conjecture/to guess
to fancy from afar/reverie/wild and fanciful thoughts
(literary) to come in quick succession/wave after wave
thoughts surging in one's mind (idiom)/different thoughts coming to mind
